public static Object retrieve(Context context,

Look in the specified servlet scope for the Object. If the scope is null look through the scopes in order (page, request, session, and application).

See Also:
retrieveCollection(Context, Object, String)

retrieveCollection

public static Collection retrieveCollection(Context context,
                                            Object collection,
                                            String scope)
                                     throws Exception
If the collection variable passed in is in fact a Collection then just return it. If it is a Map then return the Map values. If it is a String then look in the specified servlet scope for the Collection. If the scope is null look through the scopes in order (page, request, session, and application). If the collection variable is specified with a dot (.) notation then will look for a nested collection. For example foo.values will first look for an object called foo in the various servlet scopes (as described above). Once it finds it then it will look for an attribute called values, which is assumed to be a Collection.

Parameters:
collection - Either a String or Object that will represent the Collection.
Returns:
A Collection.
Throws:
Exception
